document.title: Common Core State Standards for English Language Arts

54B6E5227920467D9FBA754F1F96B165.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks demonstrating command of formal English. (SL.8.6)

0D1DDC6D832445E29BB66D068A685E51.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims, add evidence, and add interest. (SL.8.5)

1580291333D846F2BC0F34EB26F8668C.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye contact, body language, adequate volume, rate, intonation, and clear pronunciation. (SL.8.4)

6E828A284CFA44DA8FA3CD0C953F3D14.description: Students will use speaking and listening skills to prepare and present a formal speech.

615A8DEC20EB44EDA389C6F04A0C9B32.description: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness and sufficiency of the reasoning, as well as identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced. (SL.8.3)

B05AB3640EF64BB890736E8919AB3099.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and qualify or justify their own views in light of evidence. (SL 8.1.D)

BED9A089852249578151C0FF8FB222A2.description: Pose questions that connect to the ideas of several speakers, and respond to others using relevant evidence, observations, and ideas. (SL8.1.C)

4E0B0E0B81CF4798BA34910EAEED30AA.description: Explicitly refer to evidence during discussion, including context and explanation that supports, challenges, or adds on to a claim. (SL 8.1.A)

CB234A803F164C4F930363A548DC9518.description: Students will engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions with dynamic partners on topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

2D965B0335EA4392843870423E800C45.description: Acquire, use, and analyze words through meaning, structure, morphological and etymological relatives, and pronunciation (e.g.precede/recede; success/succeed). (L.8.4.B) (L.8.6)

E15AE56C30BC4FDAB9D765BF7DC586D4.description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation. (RI.8.9)

92E4379DDDEF47C5BF8773C45CB4669B.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced. (RI.8.8)

28BED88FD60742DAB1EF100898B67449.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea. (RI.8.7)

242B34916ACC4D88BE2365B77EE15885.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints. (RI.8.6)

8204FE8CA8C349EA8034FA266652B7BC.description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept. (RI.8.5)

7646BE77F23E4769B67D7BA73A1B12F6.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts. (RI.8.4) (L.8.5.A) (L.8.5.C)

3605BD41F8D94046A8B986E929095575.description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories). (RI.8.3)

8191DFE136DF441FAD45FB7384822583.description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text. (RI.8.2)

829FD0D16E5448D1AC8586BBF4DBE47C.description: Cite evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text. (RI.8.1)

66457EBF7A274ACE814A540D43803404.description: Students will examine informational texts in order to draw conclusions about the author’s purpose.

9BF848626D3042D589E13D1C28A8B8CC.description: Use context clues to determine the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word's position or function in a sentence). (L.8.4.A)

B8534CD4276F421FB800D1F75D488B12.description: Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works, including describing how the material is rendered new. (RL.8.9) [Not formally assessed]

FC97F754990C45FE8B6CB0537B4351FA.description: Describe the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors. (RL.8.7)

9B3EC6B67BB349C3B1A29C0121B9FAD5.description: Analyze how point of view and the perspectives of the characters and/or the reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor. (RL.8.6)

5AA866288B714359BC1C108C3E6BA1B4.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style. (RL.8.5)

CBC9D59B8EDC4096A54C22CE40652C3C.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts. (RL.8.4)

04FCC83BE739489F9E3522D57516C331.description: Explain how literary devices (e.g., repetition, simile, dialogue) or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision. (RL.8.3)

D7AB5CF5034B4F8E8AAA965C2D84399E.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot. (RL.8.2)

C9D655A7C2A04FB49F57D5D7D7327602.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly, as well as inferences drawn from the text. (RL.8.1)

85F06D1386D243B7A6D6142DBAAFA543.description: Students will explain how literary features contribute to the meaning of a fictional text at the 8th grade level.

C83125D2BFFC4221BBB228264C748CB4.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.8.6)

F2E943A179D341DBADDEFECBA8261D2B.description: Quote and/or paraphrase and cite data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following the MLA format for citations. (W.8.8)

7DAE3DCE19BB45658AD2274055C2C5FE.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.8.5)

2C8BD36F8E94471191001E5B439F5F4E.description: Provide a conclusion that summarizes the thesis and uses a variety of concluding strategies such as leaving the reader with a memorable thought, showing how thinking evolved, including a counter-argument and rebuttal, etc. (W.8.3.E)

3729D36220D34634B7932A679ED46D3C.description: Establish and maintain a formal style: a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person; avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my, or second person you. (W.8.2.E)

FF5963F340104C29BC694B25D424AB13.description: Engage and help the reader grasp the significance of information through a variety of techniques such as comparisons, analogies, connotative language, allusions, anecdotes, etc. (W.8.2.D)

042C0D13B5F94AC685505D266EE55B77.description: Indicate and distinguish how the claim differs from alternating or opposing views by providing a counterargument and rebuttal. (W.8.1A)

81CB87E7F3EF41919FA397409FFF49B9.description: Create cohesion within and among paragraphs by using transitional words and phrases to make clear relationships among the claim, counterclaim, reasons, evidence, and elaboration; embed evidence fluidly. (W.8.2.C)

4510F71DEC8849ADA3C147C9964F2F63.description: Analyze evidence such as well-chosen facts, definitions, details, quotations, or other examples to prove a claim. (W.8.2B)

D5EE7AF6D68E4B89B9A62DCA944B9A1E.description: Determine and employ an effective organizational structure to group reasons and evidence logically. (W.8.3.4)

DBFDBAAFDF43475D9EFECE838B9A03ED.description: Write an introduction that leads with an engaging hook, provides context/background to orient the readers to the importance of the topic, and introduces a thesis (claim + reasons) that implies organizational strategy. (W.8.2.A)

EF76AAD0E3724C569BBC82A039EB2825.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source. (W.8.8)

EAB7E82290174D3FBFCD51775840A515.description: Conduct research to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration. (W.8.7)

069075FC1AC1496B9A3B409BDFA46420.description: Students will write an argument to support a claim with clear reasons, evidence, and analysis of relevant content.

9A70404F94274404A5A9BE80AD7A33C1.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.8.6)

DC259A1229844981BCE5CCA130ED818B.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.8.5)

F96B4D2BB23645118E1FC17D36EFE89C.description: Engage and help the readers grasp the significance of information through precise word choice and a variety of craft techniques such as comparisons, analogies, connotative language, allusions, anecdotes, etc. (W.8.2.D)

A957268502D04AA586DB1067BF6AF634.description: Provide a conclusion that summarizes the thesis and uses a variety of concluding strategies such as leaving with a memorable thought, showing how thinking evolved, including a counter-argument and rebuttal, etc. (W.8.1E)

FB931CC8224E4B8B905EB996F82679AB.description: Establish and maintain a formal style: (W.8.1.D) a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person; avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my, or second-person you.

3827FAFF47A6450ABFA2CE327F2A4212.description: Create cohesion within and among paragraphs by using transitional words and phrases to make clear relationships among the claim, counterclaim, reasons, evidence, and elaboration; embed evidence fluidly. (W.8.1.C)

237BD0F47732481C9AB247ECEABA2DF8.description: Indicate and distinguish how the claim differs from alternating or opposing views by providing a counterargument and rebuttal. (W.8.1A)

EF2AAEE2F9454B939F162D24DA8333CA.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (W.8.4)

CF7CB61DB3C94B9489E0E6E73D2BCB60.description: Support and analyze the claim with sensible, logical reasoning and evidence from trustworthy sources. (W.8.1.B)

4B68E7E16BD94C65B3C18CB1EAC1AD09.description: Write an introduction that leads with an engaging hook, provides context/background to orient the readers to the importance of the topic, and introduces a thesis (claim + reasons) that implies an organizational strategy. (W.8.1.A)

9C6A4800ED1844FABB84968D65015B16.description: Students will write a literary analysis essay with a clear claim, counterclaim, supports, and evidence.

F5A05312ACC74D31BE1C7F9B610E6B34.description: Use of a variety of sentence structures including simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences correctly to show how ideas relate to each other. (L.8.2.A)

DCA72F3833F341B2860B90E67CB99234.description: Use ellipses to indicate omissions when directly citing. (L.8.2.B)

E2EC740E436244E3B58B1B366FE31A92.description: Form and use verbs in the active voice and passive voice. (L.8.1.B)

1423ED3BA6FA4DE2A4B9076706C593CB.description: Use gerunds, participles, and appositives in writing to demonstrate an understanding of the function. (L.8.1.A)

BF98FCD08E544EC69BE7ED7A92F31436.description: Students will demonstrate a command of Standard English grammar when writing.

9E55171010544CB8A3106154E5530F17.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed. (SL.7.1.B)

B90C843E6FAB406F974DD03B51623A44.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when appropriate. (SL.7.6)

0A96E5AFABAF40CAA1BF2F386B1F969A.description: Include multimedia components and displays to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points. (SL.7.5)

3133BA422A9B46E687CA958865CFB9DE.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (SL.7.4)

7458B581CA384071899F7DCD9C75EBFC.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views. (SL.7.1.D)

FD0B97A9569C4B34997D7494FA4D7074.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant observations. (SL.7.1.C)

24264269CC514951BC237C386E91BF2D.description: Explicitly refer to evidence to make logical inferences to support a claim. (SL.7.1.A)

A4B44587EF26441EB0992959C2B7EB51.description: Students will engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions with dynamic partners on topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

2701DFD1BB7A44EAA823BD40BF49F8DA.description: Synthesize and analyze words through meaning, structure, morphological and etymological relatives, and pronunciation (e.g. belligerent/bellicose; subscribe/prescription). (L.7.4.B) (L.7.6)

2C5B59A436FD4D5AB67EA79723C7C9E7.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of the text. (RI.7.9)

69727FC275C244249855D1A9A6F56AFA.description: Trace and evaluate the claim in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claim. (RI.7.8)

0752DFFB8E184C10A3C2E281326664A2.description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject. (RI.7.7)

73BA815D0F1D45DDB9677643539950CF.description: Determine the author’s point of view or purpose in a text; analyze how an author distinguishes his/her position from that of others. (RI.7.6)

62EE18E2FFB14E60836A33831A434174.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of ideas. (RI.7.5)

30F37E3F00F2421983132F441521A84D.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as used in a text, including figurative, connotative and technical meanings; analyze impact of word choice on meaning and tone. (RI.7.4)

863F545F67464D4F99456E0FFE37DCA7.description: Analyze interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events). (RI.7.3)

D447F0DFB86946E18650ACD54B2AC62D.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text. (RI.7.2)

5088AD0769E04FBB967DA1E9866B472C.description: Cite direct evidence to support analysis of a text and to support inferences drawn from a text. (RI.7.1)

A607A214CBE04762BEBA802536F733AB.description: Students will examine informational texts at the seventh grade level in order to draw conclusions about the author’s purpose.

0719053610534562B87CA752D3EBCAC0.description: Use context clues to determine the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word's position or function in a sentence). (L.7.4.A)

C65329E954EF4152976A80556049D40D.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history. (RL.7.9)

C6168EAE8FE34BFFA5255BDCEDA60BBF.description: Compare and contrast a written story or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film). (RL.7.7)

3C47DC4DC1154456A2FFDB374562EBCE.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the perspectives of different characters or narrators in a text. (RL.7.6)

EE85740D0BEA4A209B41016B77913165.description: Analyze how the structure of a poem or drama contributes to its meaning. (RL.7.5)

92350ADA07B54E088FE9E32EE0A6EC8C.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes or other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story. (RL.7.4) (L.7.5.A) (L.7.5.C)

7407FDF9366D44729B8BA16AFD6CE80E.description: Examine how particular elements of a story interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot). (RL.7.3)

5415C55845024493821F6D0B6EE1AA54.description: Determine a theme and analyze its development over the course of the text. (RL.7.2)

F9BCA1A1B3C64B47AE2E2949629AA18A.description: Cite multiple pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly, as well as inferences drawn from the text. (RL.7.1)

0A8F311D0E474875805DDE0A17EE6727.description: Students will explain how literary features contribute to the meaning of a fictional text at the 7th grade level.

F676EE80B3D84583BDB98785737AEE39.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.7.6)

112B096EF03D409196AF56C908EDE9D1.description: Quote, paraphrase and cite data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following the MLA format for citations. (W.7.8)

677F9693B4B242178BDFDF92C0E210BB.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.7.5)

42D9F9438AB9453AA2282E4E0ED1CE27.description: Provide a concluding paragraph that follows and supports the claim and evidence presented. (W.7.1.E)

A7D437CE3E924CD7BAF43887B76DA47C.description: Establish and maintain a formal style. a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person; avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my or second-person you. (W.7.1.D)

5D3D241CA72C4472A1887D121E89FA8B.description: Engage the reader by incorporating craft techniques such as imagery, anecdotes, and descriptive word choice.

B1805D7C498B459D9F6575E862008D50.description: Make connections and demonstrate relationships among ideas by using transitional words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion within a paragraph and from one paragraph to the next. (W.7.1.C)

3B5E678CB415470DBEB583E7723C8DB6.description: Analyze evidence such as well-chosen facts, definitions, details, quotations, or other examples to prove a claim. (W.7.2B)

34AC4884E42B4C40A8C9E21544BBA55C.description: Organize the reasons and evidence logically. (W.7.1.A)

72853169A7B54AE3A668045702527FB1.description: Write an introduction that includes a hook, provides context, introduces the thesis (claim + reasons) clearly, and previews an organizational strategy. (W.7.1.A)

E9D5FBF5B24547918290611259108810.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source.

39E7E59721A44D79BDBBC369994EE75C.description: Conduct research using multiple sources in order to answer a question and generate additional, focused questions. (W.7.7) (W.7.8)

3464D45E410A4B1CA6BD478D6548AF9A.description: Students will write an argument to support claims with clear reasons and evidence.

0FA351D39EBE42F990AB869B70695796.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.7.6)

97FA6220563B4169B2D4F3A9DF148134.description: Format paper to MLA requirements using a guide.

39BF4EB5949D4F13B097DD7EF0B69104.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.7.5)

8FD5C8C8B3954D248F6CFD2C09891CF3.description: Engage the reader by using precise word choice (e.g. “devastated” instead of “sad”) and domain specific words and phrases (e.g. inference, theme, comparisons) in order to affect meaning and tone. (W. 7.3.D)

5D6430D671104FC1ABE59D30830067E0.description: Provide a conclusion that summarizes the thesis and key points and leaves the reader with a memorable connection. (W.7.2.F)

A7DE3B43AF2A4EB6A4B3BD578C145BE2.description: Establish and maintain a formal style. (W.7.2.E) a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person; avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my or second-person you.

14C6CBA433D3418289C359DCF37A0BE0.description: Create cohesion within (between claim, evidence, and analysis) and among paragraphs using transitional words, phrases, and clauses. (W.7.2.C)

9667E85C01704FE1A91CDD4BB0FA3955.description: Determine and employ an effective organizational structure to group reasons and evidence logically and prove a claim. (W.7.2.A)

20EAD7FB00B047BF861B4C8798969EF1.description: Support and develop a claim with relevant reasons and evidence, including details, quotations, or examples. (W.7.2.B)

A6780177BE844D02A40EB0ADE869A070.description: Write an introduction that includes a hook, introduces the thesis (claim + reasons) clearly, and previews an organizational strategy. (W.7.2.A)

D950536821DE456D807E373E99B1235E.description: Students will write a literary analysis essay to examine a claim and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant evidence.

AF9C273760FA44D187520B5088C7109B.description: Correctly place phrases and clauses within a sentence so that meaning is clear. (L.7.1.A, L.7.1.C)

DEC45E4AA3D44039857618F0B2CF827F.description: Use commas to separate coordinate adjectives. (L.7.2.A)

D3A19BBE9F484657A8ABDA14B5EBB62D.description: Use a variety of sentence structures including simple, compound, and complex to show how ideas relate to each other. (L.7.1.A, L.7.1.B)

C6FE256B45584ABDB2AE80D1D5E0A6C9.description: Students will demonstrate a command of Standard English grammar when writing.

1C3FA96B802947F4A64E23FD7F7BFB01.description: Demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing after reviewing the key ideas expressed. (SL.6.1.D)

60D62C97B4734EC8B46F03FED739AC80.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed. (SL.6.1.B)

58DEF2A0E2994749BC8995F7BCFBC5D9.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (SL.6.6)

129761587B1748D5B82B36F1171D8E24.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify information. (SL.6.5)

DDC288AF88404CAC9AD289DAB399FCDA.description: Present claims and findings sequencing ideas logically, and using pertinent descriptions, facts and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (SL.6.4)

45E041F6F07C4126AE48D70EF4AAF57B.description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.(SL.6.1.C)

409E8F1230304D6FB0FE13CDA502B334.description: Explicitly refer to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to reflect on ideas under discussion. (SL.6.1.A)

1CE12C3E4DBC41A3936351D6425E6321.description: Students will engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions with dynamic partners on topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

BF4E38549A7440A3999CEAACDC7401AD.description: Synthesize and analyze words through meaning, structure, morphological and etymological relatives, and pronunciation (e.g. audience/inaudible; produce/production). (RI.6.10)

A9D0EFB8CB104F3CABAE495E89E13C63.description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g. a memoir and a biography of the same person). (RI.6.9)

761A3BDEC2054FEC9C49D2C10AF19A9B.description: Distinguish claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not. (RI.6.8)

4603C517CB5A4A59AEC3492422AD2D7D.description: Demonstrate coherent understanding by integrating information presented in different media or formats (visually, quantitatively/textually). (RI.6.7)

34BC6A3125044C49B104F8C97AE09196.description: Determine author’s point of view or purpose and explain how it is conveyed in a text. (RI.6.6)

7561F942FB6E403991FB646986C2511A.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of ideas. (RI.6.5)

3EF1B788C1C1498B8F665A1EFAC9D826.description: Determine meaning of words and phrases (figurative, connotative and technical). (RI.6.4)

6145B13778B74E9C970D483CA15B1550.description: Analyze how an individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text. (RI.6.3)

AB1A6E975495497A8EDCF5A3CCF3B20B.description: Determine the central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through details; provide an objective summary of text. (RI.6.2)

532459AC2E5C47EBB07DF1A105DF585F.description: Cite text evidence to support what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text. (RI.6.1)

40B3466DDA2F444C8D69D8C74BBDD49C.description: Students will examine informational texts in order to draw conclusions about the author’s purpose.

2EC5D0567E374D658C1497509E307A2C.description: Use context clues to determine the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word's position or function in a sentence). (L.6.4.A)

52B5C65BA99D4B14BAAFA41A28873427.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics. (RL.6.9)

0DE5A597D31B4A7399105AF7194982C1.description: Compare and contrast information presented in different media or formats. (RL.6.7)

430B10ED38C44430AF71833C50F6A9C7.description: Determine how the author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker (through words, actions, and thoughts) in the text. (RL.6.6)

A9D8F64DAC7249558A0E76BF841AC777.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of ideas (plot, theme, or setting). (RL.6.5)

41F985CBA97141A795D753EA08DD1000.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meaning in order to analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone. (RL.6.4)

71A7305188B84A588A0432E9BC44730A.description: Describe how a particular story's or drama's plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution. (RL.6.3)

8E81C27F124245F4A4F08B32A8CBB4C4.description: Select and support a theme of a text and how it is conveyed through details. (RL.6.2)

5CA52E5D7A014F9EA6BA92AC10995539.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text. (RL.6.1)

ABCA7C413D2F4460BD49A1F7D9BF7833.description: Students will explain how literary features contribute to the meaning of a fictional text at the 6th grade level.

07AB6F7D37B54C02A918234F53E7A4E9.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.6.6)

A7BEB6FD606E42FBB221B3BDF3F4767C.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.6.5)

B1FF19B62AD1406F8CD3D61735FC4E76.description: Write a conclusion that includes a take-away and/or shows character development, and connects to the narrated experiences. (W.6.3E)

032D07A09D344E33B2422E2E855D14AF.description: Convey experiences and events using precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language. (W.6.3D)

53BEED3DF11B4F1F9206940070DF828C.description: Develop experiences, events, and/or characters by using a variety of narrative techniques, such as dialogue, or pacing. (W.6.3B)

D5A91705EC214A0292B9C31D6DF458B2.description: Convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another by using a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses. (W.6.3C)

C066899D89F242D4BE9CCE6A3AB30962.description: Organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. (W.6.3A)

AD970B63B8A64CA6909E51EE0A17CE05.description: Engage and orient the reader by hooking the reader, establishing a context, and introducing a narrator and/or characters. (W.6.3A)

7F34656242D64778816E4601745E4CE3.description: Students will write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

7F00FE006222437382EC54B7F7B548AF.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.6.6)

7F9B065923B54BEA8522DE15E2BEE3BE.description: Quote, paraphrase and cite data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following the MLA format for citations. (W.6.8)

8051AF892A694CD39E4B3DEB89617F7C.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.6.5)

D5823B144F0445C8A8265E73FF9E27F4.description: Provide a conclusion that summarizes the thesis (claim + reasons) and leaves the reader with a memorable thought connected to the topic.  (W.6.2.F)

EF52FD3C5B15424FA658F5349F5610AC.description: Write in formal style. a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person; avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my or second-person you. (W.6.2.E)

02830DBE5B6E4E7D98725101016F75AE.description: Incorporate precise word choice and content-specific vocabulary. (W.6.2.D)

F64E03790ADC44F0B1AA3DC648D0F422.description: Make connections and demonstrate relationships among ideas within a paragraph and from one paragraph to the next using transitions. (W.6.2.C)

2D8EC55EF0B34BD7B3A7C6D44A12D987.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, details, citations, or other examples from reliable sources. (W.6.2.B)

DD96348570DE4E0D9FA4475AAC51DC09.description: Include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), or multimedia to aid comprehension. (W.6.2.A)

A9DDA0EAF736401599D980EE413AB3B2.description: Organize ideas and information using a logical structure (chronological, cause/effect, and comparison). (W.6.2.A)

9B5DD782B57949F5A022A278161CF0F9.description: Write an effective introduction that hooks the reader and provides a specific thesis (claim + reasons) that previews the topic and orients reader to the organizational structure. (W.6.2.A)

655B9DDDCA854ECCA506118ACD4B9F91.description: Students will write informational texts to support a claim with clear reasons, evidence, and explanation of relevant content.

AF7D23348DE7464EB194BC4BF9BB59A5.description: Publish writing using technology in order to share with a wider audience. (W.6.6)

D80FBB99B7F5491EB74DA1CA9B949640.description: Format paper to MLA requirements using a guide. (WS)

966E974DFB5D43848D36D92B68824256.description: Develop, strengthen, and produce writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, and collaborating with others. (W.6.5)

94BA106CF47F424294D611838F0E64DF.description: Engage the reader by accurately using precise word choice (e.g. “rose” instead of “got up”) and domain-specific words and phrases (e.g. inference; theme) in order to affect meaning. (W.6.2.D)

9A195A23502146EDAA42D02312CC4F43.description: Provide a conclusion that restates the thesis (claim + reasons) and leaves the reader with a memorable connection to the claim. (W.6.1.E)

C737D2EC63724FE0B24E1A4C31C1B92B.description: Establish and maintain a formal style. (W.6.1.D) a. Use objective voice (limited range of emotion or emotive punctuation). b. Avoid contractions and slang. c. Maintain third-person, avoid personalizing the topic with I, me, my, or second-person you

8674D77AB3544A2299AE0C1B8063FE3D.description: Make connections and demonstrate relationships among ideas by using transitions within a paragraph and from one paragraph to the next. (W.6.1.C)

8342337DDA174257A70D5BB34F998848.description: Employ an effective organization structure to group reasons and evidence logically and prove a claim. (W.6.1.A)

4F1CE52D640D4A988A2D560E38A4299D.description: Support the claim(s) with clear reasons and evidence. (W.6.1.B)

347DB161A29140719E792B64518BCEB0.description: Write an effective introduction by hooking the reader and including a clear thesis statement (claim + reasons). (W.6.1.A)

F50102C790304349B7546FF0C1E8E642.description: Students will write a literary analysis essay with a clear claim, supports, and evidence.

CE4825FEB91F415382519232FAE586F6.description: Use a variety of sentence structures including simple and compound to show how ideas relate to each other.  (L.6.3A)

964EF3579B8646F6BA7007614C8E1711.description: Set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements by using commas, parentheses, and dashes. (L.6.2.A)

C76026BB37CB4D73A6D045634933D991.description: Identify and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents). (L.6.1.D)

D3EC8BF35BE84B85B8A7D9E8D64B186A.description: Identify and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person. (L.6.1.C)

6BFB622DC5894FAEACCC01FFFC80C564.description: Maintain the proper case of pronouns (subjective, objective, possessive, and intensive). (L.6.1.A, L.6.1.B)

29FD0C72FFD840A0B3085FB4918F5C1C.description: Students will demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar when writing.
